programme.title: Wildest Africa: Nile: An African Odyssey

programme.desc: Philadelphia's Vidocq Society, named after an 18th Century French detective, is one of the world's most unusual crime-solving organizations.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Elements Of Murder
programme.desc: There are several things that can suggest murder; jealousy, anger, poison. When everyday substances reveal hidden clues that break a homicide case, those substances become the elements of murder.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Patterns Of Guilt
programme.desc: The tread of a tire, a single shoe print and even the shape of a bruise help investigators track down killers, based solely on their patterns of guilt.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Random Targets
programme.desc: Most victims of multiple murderers are meticulously chosen because of a mutual connection with the killer or because they match an intricate set of criteria that fits the killer's MO.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Left At The Scene
programme.desc: The tiniest residue left at the scene can become a mark of distinction in the most singular and intimate of ways.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The remaining contestants visit BLT Steak, where the winner will be working. Back at Hell's Kitchen, the team which produces the best food receives a trip to Venice Beach, while the losers have to go back to the kitchen to perform prep work.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The teams must cook three dishes each requiring a progressively shorter amount of time with the prize being a shopping trip.

programme.title: Full Custom Garage
programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel continues the transformation of the two Ford Falcons. Part 2 of 2.

programme.desc: Car builder Ian Roussel takes on a classic 1958 Harley Davidson and a 1984 Kawasaki police cruiser.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Rommie is rebuilt to help evacuate the Seefra system.

programme.title: Andromeda: One More Day's Light

programme.title: Andromeda: Chaos and the Stillness of It
programme.desc: Dylan, Rhade and Beka work together to rescue Trance from Methus-2 and Harper from General Burma.

programme.title: Andromeda: The Heart of the Journey (Part 1)
programme.desc: The crew finally makes it out of the Seefra system and discovers Dylan is the last Paradine.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: The final battle to save the New Systems Commonwealth begins.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: After being left stranded near a black hole, Captain Dylan Hunt is discovered by a mercenary salvage ship and finds he has been frozen in time for 300 years.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Out of the Dark
programme.desc: Described as a brutal execution, 46-year-old grandmother Chattrice Maihi-Carroll was found naked, stabbed to death in her New Zealand home in 2008. There were multiple suspects and everything seemed resolved following the arrest of a neighbour.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost for Words
programme.desc: Spirited teenager Jayne Furlong dreamed of becoming a child psychologist - instead, she ended up a prostitute. In 1993, 17 year old Jayne vanished from her patch on Auckland's Karangahape Road.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Psychics Revealed - Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the psychics on the show.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Blood Money
programme.desc: Psychics Kelvin Cruickshank (NZ) and Deb Webber (Aus) investigate the unsolved murder of Lower Hutt pensioner 91 year old George Engelbrecht. In 1979, a burglar broke into George's home and beat the old man to death in his bed.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: The Lie of the Land
programme.desc: Sue Nicholson and Deb Webber investigate one of the most complex and intriguing cases ever featured - did Waikato man Jason Dark commit suicide or was he murdered, as his family believes?

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Girls Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Sallie-Anne Huckstepp and Juanita Nielsen were iconic figures in the shadowy King’s Cross scene of the 1970s and 1980s. They lived dangerous lives – challenging the status quo of the period and met with mysterious and violent deaths.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Blood Sport: The Bondi Gay Murders
programme.desc: In the late 1980s and early 1990s a series of violent murders took place near Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Ivan Milat: The Backpacker Murders
programme.desc: The backpacker murder case in the Belanglo State Forest, south west of Sydney, has entered Australian criminal folklore.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Anita Cobby Murder
programme.desc: In February 1986, nurse Anita Cobby, a former entrant in the Miss Australia quest, is walking home from Blacktown station in Sydney's outer-western suburbs. A Holden sedan pulls up and Anita is dragged into the vehicle.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Killing Fields of Truro
programme.desc: For the 2008 launch of Crime Investigation Australia, CI presents the complete and compelling story of "The Killing Fields of Truro", one of the most infamous crimes in Australia and yet another set in Adelaide.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: As an emu plague descends upon Drovers Run, Claire is challenged by the demands of her newborn baby.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Peter’s return to Drover’s Run during the naming ceremony of his and Claire’s baby daughter, leads to a very important decision.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Meg is dedicating herself to her studies in order to prove herself at TAFE, and is thoroughly immersed in ‘Pride and Prejudice’. The misunderstandings of character that drive that classic echo through everyone’s dealings at Drovers Run.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Becky and Jake use Stormcloud to set up a stud on Drovers, going into partnership with Claire and Tess for the use of their land and reputation. Claire finds it hard not to be involved, a horse stud has long been her dream.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: ALEX and NICK come to the rescue of an attractive woman ELLIE, when her car breaks down on a country road. Almost instantly they’re pitched into a competition to win her, and the lead shifts from one to the other as each shines with his own charm.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Vince, keen on Claire, convinces her to nominate for the vacant position on the Gungellan Farmers Council. Tess volunteers herself as her campaign manager and speechwriter.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Lisa Lisson, the first female president of FedEx Express Canada, goes undercover to find out if her employees have the right resources to provide exceptional service in the fiercely competitive courier industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: CEO John Tracogna goes undercover at Canada’s largest zoo to get up close and personal with endangered wildlife and the people that keep the organization running.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Michael Sneyd, CEO of mega resort business Skyline International Development, goes undercover to get creative with the employees at the foot of the chain and take their ideas to new heights.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Mark King, the CEO of the world’s top golf equipment brand, Taylor Made, goes undercover as Al Bower, an unemployed golf enthusiast trying to land his dream job in the golf industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: The Victorian Order of Nurses takes the pressure off hospitals by providing care for people in their own homes. Hundreds of rival companies compete for cash and customers.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) City Councillor and TTC Chair Karen Stintz goes undercover inside the country's largest mass transit system to get her hands dirty with some of the toughest and grittiest jobs.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Sloss Furnaces
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS travels to Alabama to investigate Sloss Furnaces, a 50-acre industrial plantoperating from 1882 until the 1970s.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Moonshine & Madness
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters: slavery, murder and madness are behind the hauntings at the notorious Graham Mansion. TAPS travels to Virginia to determine the true source of the claims that have taken place at this historical location.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Frighternity
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS heads out to investigate the U.S. Naval Institute in Annapolis, Maryland, where a marine's death remains a mystery...and his ghost still roams the property.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Episode 12
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: The Coroner's Case
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS is called to Shreveport, Louisiana where the employees and owner of the Rendall Building are experiencing terrifying paranormal activity.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Girl Trouble
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie. But Thelma and Louise they ain't.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Seeing the Light
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team but they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: When a Stranger Calls
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call - The Dog!? And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Jack & Jill
programme.desc: Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses. Also, Dog has crossed paths with the brother before. He once tried to stop Dog from arresting one of the most violent fugitives of his career.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Island Hopper
programme.desc: When a brother bondsman from Washington State calls Dog for help tracking a runner in search of fun in the sun on the tropical paradise of Kauai, the team gets on the case. Dog's only problem? No leads!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Nice Guys Finish Last
programme.desc: Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, but the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent? And making matters worse, when they hit his apartment they learn he is moving out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back Behind Bars
programme.desc: While tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland struggles to find time to train and compete for his first boxing match in years.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Family Man
programme.desc: Dog and family head to Kona to track down a wanted father who's looking to bolt to the mainland to evade sentencing. Meanwhile, Dog does some evading of his own - Avoiding the much dreaded birthday party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: All in the Family
programme.desc: Dog and the team need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives. The case is a family affair with both mother and daughter in trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mother Courage
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Shot Thru The Heart
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Lizard, Lizard
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hallu-Si-Nations
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous 'Black Panther'.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Let's Go Hunting, Deer
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city." At Phil and Kay's, Miss Kay decides she wants to frame Phil's original blueprints from the first duck call he created.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Tickets To The Fun Show
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room. The massage chair becomes a detriment to the workflow, so Willie takes Si around for a replacement prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Be a Lady
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bass Man Standing
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Battle of the Brothers
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dyeing his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Aloha, Robertsons!
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii. But Willie's daily itinerary for the trip gets constantly undermined by the family's desire to participate in their own island activities.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: In Crawford Bay near Nelson British Columbia, search teams are looking for a missing 1946 two-seater vintage Ercoupe.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue combs the backcountry for a missing snowshoer.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson SAR takes a maiden voyage in their new rescue boat to save a single mother and her young son.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Lions Bay and North Shore Rescue team up to long-line a severely injured French mountain climber off a steep rock face.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson Search and Rescue is en route to the scene of a helicopter crash in the Kootenay River.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson Search and Rescue rookies get a chance to show their stuff while helping an injured hiker.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson SAR uses underwater drop cameras to find a missing jet skier in the Kootenay River.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: In the southern interior of British Columbia, Penticton SAR lowers a stretcher team down a steep embankment to rescue an injured driver who was thrown from his car.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whiteout conditions critically delay Pemberton SAR’s search for a lost snowmobiler. And later, surviving an avalanche!

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue turns a missing out of bounds snowboarder into a crusader of mountain safety.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Super Freak
programme.desc: Khasha says Jermaine is always too busy for her and doesn't respect her. Jermaine says his young girlfriend wants sex all the time and is extremely messy! Can Judge Toler help them find a middle ground?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Can't Buy Love
programme.desc: Chimira gets lavish vacations, gifts and a designer wardrobe from Bennie, but suspects he is cheating on her. Bennie says she should be grateful for her good life. Can Bennie learn to give his time and support instead of luxuries and an empty home?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Old Town Road
programme.desc: Jennifer says Josh's lies have left her and their family homeless. He has made many hurtful decisions like selling her car and dumping her dog while she was giving birth to their son. Can he pave the way for a future?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Track Me Down
programme.desc: Briana is suspicious of Geovani because she claims he is way too sexual and can’t keep his hands off her. She thinks that if he has that much drive for her, how could he not have it for other women.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Once a Cheater Always a Cheater
programme.desc: Alyssia says Devonte is a serial cheater, but wants to save their relationship. He says she's insecure and stalks his social media. They share a child, but Devonte doesn't want to commit if she won't change. Can Judge Toler help them?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Speak My Truth
programme.desc: Chante says her boyfriend, Steve of 8 years is trying to end her “hot girl summer.” Not only that, but he doesn’t trust her, is controlling and wants to marry her. Chante isn’t ready for marriage and just wants to have fun.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Down in the DM
programme.desc: Clifford feels that Asia is always searching for things that aren’t there. Asia says she is done with Clifford and the way he uses social media to flirt and cheat with women. Can Judge Lynn Toler help put a stop to the arguing?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Irreplaceable
programme.desc: Quanasia can no longer deal with Chandler's lying just so he can have his affairs. Chandler says she lost her drive after having his kids. Can Judge Toler wake her up from Chandler's hypnotizing charm or is this couple a lost cause?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Brexit
programme.desc: Over 17 years of marriage Leon has had countless affairs with other women and Siobhan has had it. She claims all he wants is for her to keep his house clean and pick up after him. Leon argues that the problems stem from Siobhan’s bad drinking habits.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Done Done
programme.desc: Nichele says Stewart would pay the neighbors to spy on her. She says he was never supportive when it came to parenting. Stewart says Nichele has always denied cheating on him but he believes in his heart she did.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Fantasy Fail
programme.desc: Victoria is sick of Casey neglecting his responsibilities. Casey feels like a slave for taking care of the kids while she flies around the world for modeling gigs. Can Casey break out of the Mr. Mom role and start helping with the bills?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 1
programme.desc: Jacoby Garrett is fighting to save his marriage of 15 years. Meanwhile his wife, Kim Garrett has her belongings packed and is waiting on the moving truck.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Mystery of Mona Lisa
programme.desc: When Lyssa points out that the fugitive in the next case has the same birth date as Barbara, Dog's recently deceased daughter, the team takes a special vow to capture the young woman.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Time to Cry
programme.desc: Kimo does a vanishing act for his day in court and now Dog and the posse have to find him. With precious few leads to follow Dog turns to the fugitive's on-again-off-again girlfriend, but she's initially reluctant to join the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Best of . . .
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Operation Repo starts 9pm
programme.desc: STARTS 9PM Take a ride along with Operation Repo! This docudrama series takes an in-depth look at the professional, but sometimes murky world of car repossession. Get ready for the drama!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Jump Start
programme.desc: Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab. But this commitment to rehabilitation seems to have ended when he bolted from the car on the way to the drug treatment center and went on the run.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: If You Knew Nunu
programme.desc: Dog and the team really have their hands full when they go after a tough guy named Nunu, who leads them on a chase through apartment complexes and a shopping mall before he's finally captured.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Trouble in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Play Date Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne and Nick go out with another couple, but the double date soon fizzles when an accusation flies.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Lindsey Gets High Episode
programme.desc: Former child star Todd Bridges guides Lindsey on a wild odyssey to teach her the dangers of drug use. Ice Cube, Charlie Murphy and Jerry Springer also guest star.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Liar, Liar Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne insists that everyone in the family tell the truth at all times after she catches Nick in a lie.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Fight Party Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne's book group and Nick's boxing-match party collide in the family room on the same night, resulting in knock-out clashing.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Nick's Kid Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne suspects that Nick may have fathered his ex-flame's son. Ice Cube and Kandi Burruss guest star.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Kevin Gets a Commercial Episode
programme.desc: Kevin's burgeoning career as a child actor has a negative fallout when a potential big break goes to his head. Ted Lange guest stars.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Suzanne's Surprise Party Episode
programme.desc: Nick secretly plans a surprise for Suzanne to help her overcome a traumatic childhood experience.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Mother's Day Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne and Marilyn convene for a spa weekend for Mother's Day, but friction soon mounts between the two.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Lindsey Goes Vegan Episode
programme.desc: Lindsey decides to take on a vegan diet and lifestyle, but she may have ulterior motives in doing so.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Mr. Almost Episode
programme.desc: Nick runs into an old college friend, who convinces him to bring Deion Sanders aboard his energy drink business – with humiliating consequences.

programme.title: Are We There Yet?: The Play Date Episode
programme.desc: Suzanne and Nick go out with another couple, but the double date soon fizzles when an accusation flies.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Cemetery
programme.desc: PRS visits a gothic graveyard, where a jealous spirit seems to be preying on the newlywed wife of the cemetery's caretaker. Ryan traces the haunting to a mysterious, unclaimed cremation urn on the grounds.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Glove
programme.desc: When a terrifying haunting threatens to break a Daisytown, PA couple apart, PRS is their last resort. As the investigation deepens, PRS and the family learn that it's just the tip of iceberg, turns out this haunting might be all in the family.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Darkness Falls

programme.desc: Ryan leads his team to one of the most haunted places in the US to confront their fears and solve a paranormal mystery. Aside from the alleged spirits of dead prisoners, something even darker may be lurking inside West Virginia State Penitentiary.

programme.title: Paranormal State: I Am Six

programme.title: Paranormal State: Hostage to Fear

programme.title: Paranormal State: Laws of Attraction

programme.title: Leopard Inn Pt 2

programme.title: Leopard Inn Pt 3

programme.desc: With both sets of house hunters determined to have it all, Kirstie and Phil are going to have to use all the tricks of the trade if they're going to help them move forward and hopefully into the house of their dreams!

programme.title: Dynasty: The Roof
programme.desc: Michael goes to Denver to find out who he is. Alexis and Cecil plan a wedding in the hospital. Claudia disappears and Blake suspects her of kidnapping the baby. There's an exiting drama on the roof of a tall building.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Wedding
programme.desc: The baby is recovered from the real kidnapper, Alfred Grimes, and it turns out he's the father of Roger Grimes. Fallon fires Susan. Claudia leaves for a sanitarium. Fallon starts looking for a job. Blake gives her his hotel La Mirada.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Will
programme.desc: Cecil leaves his estate and Colbyco to Jeff and Alexis. He also reveals his "Rhinewood" game to Blake at the reading of his will. Blake suspects Alexis of being a part of it.

programme.title: Dynasty: The Siblings
programme.desc: Alexis gives her newfound long-lost son Adam a job at Colbyco. Blake starts to believe that Adam may actually be his real son. Fallon and Adam keep flirting with each other, not knowing they are siblings. Adam has dinner with Krystle and Blake.

programme.title: Dynasty: Mark
programme.desc: Blake tries to be friends with Adam, but Adam rejects him. Alexis tells Mark that he's still married to Krystle. Mark seeks to get a job as a tennis pro at Fallon's hotel.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.249
programme.desc: A woman sues her son for eviction fees and stopping payment on an apartment. A teen's father breaks his son's phone used for alleged drug purchases, leaving the other teen's father with the bill.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.147
programme.desc: Teen accused of car vandalism; alleges pepper spray incident. Teen uses loan for stepfather's rims; sues for repayment and totaled car balance.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.21
programme.desc: Partygoer punched, falls into window, needs 30 stitches; assaulter alleges invasion of personal space/Surprise party host sues friends for fighting, property damage/Woman accused of keying car denies jealousy retaliation involving boyfriend.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.177
programme.desc: Woman's front teeth cracked when intoxicated dancer trips and knocks into her at bar. Dancer denies wrongdoing. 15-year-old accused of breaking pizzeria window denies involvement but refuses to implicate friend. Police provide different account.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.64
programme.desc: A woman claims she was doused with lighter fluid during an argument with her ex-roommate; he claims she had him falsely arrested and countersues for return of belongings.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.65
programme.desc: Man allegedly damages SUV during child custody exchange, claims admission under duress. Teenager sued by older sister for scooter balance; teen claims vehicle given in exchange for care of grandmother.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.179
programme.desc: An angry man backs into a neighbor's car after receiving a nasty note from his lover, blaming her for the damages. A teenager jumps on a car to avoid a pit bull, but doubts arise when he admits the car belonged to someone who owed him money.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.134
programme.desc: Ex-lovers dispute $200,000+ debt, a pistol, and a high school ring as gifts or loans; jealousy involved. Woman and best friend's daughter-in-law disagree on eBay sales proceeds' whereabouts, one claims check was mailed.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.136
programme.desc: Man racks up $3,600 on ex's credit card, claims shared benefit; childhood friends dispute dating, feud over big-screen TV ownership.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.221
programme.desc: An 8-year-old boy calls his father after an argument with his mother, leading to a fight and damaged property. A woman sues her ex-boyfriend for stealing her quad runner and wrecking her car; he alleges harassment.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.38
programme.desc: Man's jaw broken at party, misses Thanksgiving dinner, sues assailant/Woman sues ex for TV value, unpaid phone bill; he claims TV sold to unreachable friend.

programme.title: CBS Saturday Morning

programme.title: World's Greatest: Island Nations
programme.desc: Though many are small in stature, they have punched well above their weight on the global stage. Some are rooted in ancient history, while others are only just beginning to realize their full potential.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Flights
programme.desc: Our experience of the world’s greatest marvels is literally and figuratively elevated when we explore them from the air. Whether you travel by air balloon, helicopter, light aircraft, a grand perspective is always guaranteed.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Wetland Animals
programme.desc: Wetland Animals dives into the swamps, rivers, and flood plains of the Everglades, Botswana’s Okavango Delta, Kakadu National Park in Australia, and the Amazon to see deadly crocodiles, piranhas, hippopotamus, flamingo, manatee, and platypus.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Forest Animals
programme.desc: Forest Animals gets up close with bears, koalas, moose, wolves, weaver ants, and Tasmanian Devils. This episode roves dark forests floors and soars above vast canopies of green in America, China, Laos, and Australia.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Bridges
programme.desc: A bridge is a structure that’s designed to transcend, but a great bridge can define the place where it stands. Symbols of human ingenuity, beauty, and grandeur, bridges connect us not only to each other but also to the past.

programme.title: Arthur: Muffy's Art Attack/Tales from the Crib
programme.desc: When Muffy sees a kinetic sculptor’s machines, she brags that she can make even better ones. Then, Vicita is upset at having to trade in her cherished crib for a big-girl bed, so D.W. shares her story of that same rite of passage.

programme.title: Arthur: Follow the Bouncing Ball/Buster Baxter and the Letter from the Sea
programme.desc: Alberto Molina's beloved soccer ball--signed by his favorite Ecuadorian soccer star --is lost! While on vacation, Buster discovers a message in a bottle on the shore. Could it be a message from the people of the lost city of Atlantis?

programme.title: Arthur: The Boy Who Cried Comet/Arthur and Los Vecinos
programme.desc: Buster is convinced that he's seen real UFO's, and he uses Muffy's fancy new telescope to get the proof. Then, Mr. Sipple from next door is moving away and Arthur wonders--who will be the new neighbors?

programme.title: Arthur: Fernlets by Fern/Prunella and the Haunted Locker
programme.desc: Muffy talks Fern into writing poems for a new line of greeting cards which becomes the hit of Elwood City, but booming business causes Fern to burn out. Prunella is assigned a new school locker, which is rumored to be haunted!

programme.title: Arthur: Rhyme For Your Life/For Whom The Bell Tolls
programme.desc: While struggling to write a poem for his mom, Binky falls asleep and gets trapped in Verseberg--where it's a crime not to rhyme! And D.W. has lost her voice! For Arthur it's a dream come true--until Mom asks Arthur to take care of D.W.

programme.title: Arthur: The Hallway Minotaur/Ladonna's Like List
programme.desc: Attention Lakewood Elementary! There's a new sheriff—er--hallway monitor-in town, and his name is George Lundgren. Ladonna Compson is friendly, funny, and full of personality. Everyone likes her! At least, that's what she thought.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Unravels/All the Rage
programme.desc: Grandma Thora teaches Arthur to knit and he's really into this new hobby. But…he's a kid! And a boy! Knitting is a grandma thing, right? And, Muffy wants to rock the fashion world, but creating a fad is a lot harder than it looks.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Toy Trouble/Spar for the Course
programme.desc: It's a race to the toy store after Arthur realizes he may have given away his chance at 2 million dollars! Unless Muffy, Buster, and Binky can comprise, they'll be stuck with a boring windmill at the new 18th hole at the mini golf course.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Almost Boring Day/The Half-Baked Sale
programme.desc: It's raining and boy is it BORING! But then, in Grandma Thora's attic, Arthur and D.W. discover some really FASCINATING stuff about their parents. Next, Grandma Thora is helping to organize a bake sale, but her goodies aren’t very good.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The RAF’s maritime role is often overlooked. Between the wars the RAF operated elegant flying boats to patrol the far flung corners of the Empire.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: After the war, RAF transports helped keep Berliners alive during the Soviet blockade of the city in 1948/49. As well as flying round-the-clock operations into the airport, Sunderland flying boats delivered supplies by landing on Lake Havel near the city.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the First World War the RAF had bombers that could fly to Berlin and back. For the first time in a thousand years British civilians found themselves under direct attack - by Zeppelin airships and Gotha bombers.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the war the RAF had aircraft that could escort bombers to targets deep inside Germany and back. With the Gloster Meteor, the RAF had also entered the ‘Jet Age’. Aircraft like the Hawker Hunter and F-86 Sabre took the RAF supersonic.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The 1920s and 30s were uncertain times for the RAF as well as all other armed services. With peace came cuts in spending on new aircraft development.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Dorion & Jeszica
programme.desc: Dorion is about to give up everything for online love Jeszica, including his relationship with girlfriend Raffinee. But first he wants to know, is Jeszica really the girl in the pictures?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Tracie & Sammie
programme.desc: Tracie Thoms had a connection with a fan named 'Sammie' after hearing about the passing of Sammie's friend. Sammie suddenly disappeared and now Tracie is left wondering who Sammie really is?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Brendan loves McKenna, but failed attempts to connect have left him wondering if McKenna is for real. Nev teams with social media sensation Karrueche Tran to help Brendan uncover the truth. (S5, ep4)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Stephanie & David
programme.desc: Catfish brings together couples who've interacted solely through screens. In this edition, Stephanie searches for the man she's been talking to in an unseen episode.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Rob & Sarah
programme.desc: Oobah is joined by Nathan Henry to help Rob track down his soulmate, Sarah. After two and a half years, Sarah has suddenly gone quiet and it's up to Oobah and Nathan to investigate. (S2, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Fans of popular YouTube star Andrea Russett call on Nev and Max to help catch a potential stalker who is impersonating Andrea's family online. What the guys uncover will shock even them. (S5, ep17)

programme.title: The City: Good Things Come In Threes
programme.desc: Whitney dates a new guy and Jay confesses to Adam his true feelings about Whitney. (S1, ep4)

programme.title: The City: Boys Night Out
programme.desc: Adam lets loose while his girlfriend Allie is out of town, but when she hears he kissed another girl from Whitney and the others, Adam finds himself in hot water. (S1, ep5)

programme.title: The City: He Never Said He Had a Girlfriend
programme.desc: Allie breaks down after a run in with the girl who claims she kissed Adam, but Adam sticks to his story to win Allie back, and Whitney gets upset with Jay for taking Adam's side. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: The City: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: Kelly Cutrone accuses Allie of being too skinny, and Whitney finds herself caught in the middle. Erin runs into an ex-boyfriend and old feelings begin to return. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: The City: Mingling with the Commoners
programme.desc: Olivia invites Jay's band to perform at one of her charity events but her plan backfires when the band is disrespected on-stage, leaving Whitney and Olivia at odds. (s1, ep8)

programme.title: The Hills: Somebody Always Has to Cry
programme.desc: It's the gang's first holiday in LA but not everyone gets what they wish for. A New Year's kiss is hard to come by for Lauren when Jason learns she got a call from an old flame. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: The Hills: You Can't Just Be With Me?
programme.desc: Jason wants to make Lauren's 20th birthday special, but when she lies to him about working with male models for a Teen Vogue assignment, their relationship is put to the test. (S1, ep8)

programme.title: The Hills: Love is Not a Maybe Thing
programme.desc: Heidi decides she's had enough drama with Jordan. When she turns to the girls for advice, she realises what she has to do. And are Lauren and Jason's fighting days finally behind them? (S1, ep9)

programme.title: The Hills: Timing is Everything
programme.desc: Lauren's work at LA Fashion Week brings a career opportunity of a lifetime, but she's torn between her job and Jason. Whitney leaves LA; Heidi and Audrina are single in the city. (S1, ep10)

programme.title: The Hills: Out With The Old
programme.desc: After a rocky summer with her boyfriend Jason, Lauren decides to break it off and returns to work to face her boss. Heidi finds herself in trouble with a guy both she and Audrina are dating. (S2, ep1)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Alex Pascall and some children sing to their dolls to rock them to sleep. Laa-Laa wants to sing a lovely song to Dipsy and Po, but Tinky Winky is crunching his Tubby Toast too loudly!

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po remembers to snow. The Tubbies watch an international Christmas insert. The Teletubbies explore Teletubbyland; they are very excited when they discover that the house, trees and everything is covered in snow.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are in Home Hill making loud footstep noises, but Tinky Winky has spilt Tubby Custard on his foot. Who should clean it up? A group of children go for a walk in the woods to play with the autumn leaves.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet rises and play some music and the Teletubbies dance. A little girl shows us her piano and the sound the keys make. Another voice trumpet makes a big roaring noise.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies pop up from behind the hills to say “Eh-oh!” before watching three children and Andy Brown look in Rock pools for shrimps. Tinky Winky, Dipsy & Laa-Laa look for Po.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch children making a boat they then put it in a paddling pool to see if it will float. Tinky Winky’s bag falls in a puddle.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Bentley is organising a winter fair in the town hall square and enlists Bob to help set up the stalls, lights and the centrepiece of the fair – a giant inflatable Santa Claus.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team are building a bunkhouse for Farmer Pickles guests The Pickers! Micky, Vicky and Little Ricky are helping with the sunflower harvest. The cabin is to be made of logs so Lofty’s job is very important today, lifting and laying the logs.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Its early morning in Sunflower Valley and Benny arrives bursting with enthusiasm. He’s not needed in Bobsville today and he’s come to the Valley to help. Today, the team are building Mr and Mrs Bentley’s special new house.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Wendy and Bob have a very special announcement to make. They are going to fix up an old Houseboat for Wendy to live in. There’s a lot of hard work to be done. They need to make a gang plank, fix solar panels and give it a really good clean.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Scoop and Skip are helping Mr Beasley to install a new Rockery when Mr Bentley appears to ask for Bob’s help. The Mayor wants to stage an art exhibition, but there are no available venues. Scoop suggests renovating the inside of the Old Mill.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Fothergill has a nasty case of dry rot, so Bob and crew will have to use some smelly chemicals to fix it. As these will affect Mr Fothergill’s allergies, he goes to his sister’s for the day. But she doesn’t get on with Hamish, his pet parrot.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Whilst Bob and the team build Annie Pickles new seafront house, Muck is worried that Scoop is a better digger than he is and decides to prove himself with a sandcastle competition.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob has been asked to install a new air conditioning unit at Mr Sabatini’s restaurant. Wendy and Molly meanwhile have been asked to redecorate the library at the school.

programme.title: When Bob Became a Builder
programme.desc: It’s a beautiful day in Sunflower Valley and Bob and his machine team are building a new picnic area at the beach. Dizzy, Lofty and Scrambler are clearing stuff that’s been washed up on the beach, while Benny has a great time digging with Scoop and Muck.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles has decided to open a camp site on his land, and Bob is installing a shower block and fence to keep the sheep out. For once, he is working on his own while Wendy goes on holiday with Jenny.

programme.title: Bob's Big Plan
programme.desc: When Bob and the team are building an extension to the offices of Mr Adams the local architect, Bob hears of a competition to build a brand new town in nearby Sunflower Valley, a place Bob knows very well from his childhood. Mr Adams shows Bob his idea.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is replacing a potting shed on Mr Beasley’s allotment. In the old shed is a chest which Mr Beasley doesn’t need any more. Meanwhile Wendy calls at JJ’s for the materials for the new shed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is erecting a tent to accommodate some newcomers to the valley. Mr Bentley is organising everything, but unfortunately leaves his phone with Spud who promptly declares himself ‘Mr Bentley’s Assistant’.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Ellis has a batch of Doves delivered, to use in his magic act, and asks Bob to build a dovecote for his new birds to live in. Mr Ellis realises that he has to go to work but does not want to leave the birds at home alone.

programme.title: Race to the Finish
programme.desc: Mayor Bentley announces that Sunflower Valley is to stage its very first athletics tournament. A team from Sunflower Valley is to compete against a team of visiting athletes. Plus there is to be a special machine event!

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Sally Anne Bowman

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Gemma McCluskie

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: The Dunblane Massacre

programme.title: Girlfriends: What Had Happened Was...
